channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Donald Trump ignores compulsory masks sign as he tours MASK factory
item.description: President Donald Trump ignored signs requiring a mask be worn when he toured a mask factory in Arizona and only wore safety goggles to protect his eyes.

item.title: Second deadly coronavirus peak CAN be stopped with UK's new 'test, track and trace' app
item.description: A second coronavirus peak can be avoided with the help of the NHS's new contact-tracing app, the Government's chief scientific adviser Sir Patrick Vallance told Parliament yesterday.

item.title: Horrific video shows black man who was out for a run shot dead by two men
item.description: The video circulated across social media on the same day as a statement from a Georgia prosecutor that he wants a grand jury to decide if charges are warranted against the men.

item.title: Prince Harry sells £50,000 hunting rifles as Dr Jane Goodall says 'Meghan doesn't like hunting'
item.description: Prince Harry sold a pair of hunting rifles before leaving the UK for North America, it has been revealed. The news comes after Jane Goodall revealed Harry, who has hunted buffalo, could stop hunting altogether.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Matt Hancock accused of sexist remark to MP
item.description: The Health Secretary disagreed when Dr Rosena Allin-Khan said the policy had 'cost lives' in the UK and told her she should 'take a leaf out of the shadow secretary of state's book for tone'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Under-45s should be working, says Alex Brunner
item.description: ALEX BRUMMER: In spite of best government efforts the nation is heading for a slump, a surge of insolvencies and levels of unemployment almost certainly not seen in our lifetimes. Action is needed.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson reveals she has joined LinkedIn as she shows off a VERY glam profile picture
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, shared the news on Instagram and Twitter on Tuesday evening, while posting an image of her new profile picture.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Neil Ferguson QUITS after breaking restrictions
item.description: Neil Ferguson, who advised Boris Johnson to introduce lockdown measures to combat coronavirus, has resigned after his married lover travelled across London to meet him twice.

item.title: Republican senators to block 48 of the most advanced fighter jets ever created being deployed to UK
item.description: Republican senators are trying to block 48 of the most advanced fighter jets ever created from being deployed to the UK, over Huawei's involvement in building Britain's 5G wireless network.
item.media:credit: U.S. Air Force photo by R. Nial Bradshaw

item.title: Sports dietitian, 31, reveals the weight loss tips that REALLY work
item.description: Leading sports dietitian Leanne Ward, from Brisbane, has revealed the weight loss tips that will really give you results, as well as what she eats in a typical day to stay looking and feeling her best.

item.title: Joyriders wreck £60,000 Range Rover in horror car crash just moments after 'stealing it' in London
item.description: The two suspected thieves smashed the £60,000 vehicle on Brighton Road in Purley, south London, at 3.30am on Monday.

item.title: 48-storey UAE skyscraper is engulfed in flames
item.description: The Abbco Tower, one of the largest skyscrapers in the city of Sharjah - which is located above Dubai in the UAE - was engulfed in flames shortly after 9pm local time last night.

item.title: Israel vows to continue operations in Syria until Iran leaves
item.description: Israel will keep up its operations in Syria until its arch enemy Iran leaves, Defence Minister Naftali Bennett said yesterday after strikes on Iranian-backed militias and their allies killed 14 fighters.

item.title: New coronavirus test uses CRISPR gene-editing too to detect virus
item.description: One of the teams of scientists that first developed the gene-editing tool has altered it so that it can search out viral RNA instead of human DNA for a test that could even eventually be run at home.
item.media:credit: McGovern Institute for Brain Research / MIT et al

item.title: Facemask-wearing couples reunite in Naples for the first time since March
item.description: Couples in Naples kissed and embraced each other yesterday, with millions of Italians finally allowed to meet friends and family for the first time since March 9.

item.title: EastEnders PICTURE EXCLUSIVE: The new Queen Vic pub is FINALLY revealed
item.description: The iconic pub had previously been shrouded in plastic sheeting and scaffolding as work on the building was underway, but the brand new pale brick exterior of the Queen Vic is now visible.

item.title: Disneyland Shanghai to reopen on Monday with social distancing measures remaining in place
item.description: Walt Disney CEO Bob Chapek revealed Disneyland Shanghai (left) will reopen its gates on Monday, becoming the first Disney theme park to start operating again after COVID-19.

item.title: Rebekah Vardy is 'demanding a public apology from Coleen Rooney to put an end to their feud'
item.description: Hours after the WAGs were set to face off in their first virtual meeting since the feud was ignited seven months ago, Rebekah, 38, reportedly said she would settle for nothing less than a public apology.

item.title: Simon Cowell and Lauren Silverman rubbish 'ridiculous' Mel B affair claims
item.description: A source exclusively told MailOnline that the couple were 'very happy' and are isolating in LA, following claims that Lauren, 42, had furiously accused Simon, 60, of having an affair with Mel B, 44.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Not cricket? Elite club MCC plans to let wealthy fans join for £80,000
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE - Members of the MCC have been left outraged after talk of an extraordinary and 'radical' proposal started to filter among the masses.

item.title: Dairy farmers face ruin
item.description: Farmers are getting just 15p a litre.The closure of thousands of coffee shops and food businesses has created a glut, meaning some farmers have been told to pour away huge quantities of milk.

item.title: Wild theories circulate that Kim Jong Un uses a body double
item.description: North Korean state media broadcast images of Kim at a ribbon-cutting ceremony at a fertiliser plant on the outskirts of Pyongyang on Friday, his first appearance since April 11.

item.title: Restaurant empire Caprice Holdings makes 75,000 meals a week
item.description: Caprice Holdings hospitality establishments, which include Mayfair celebrity hotspots such as Scott's, Annabel's and Sexy Fish, are preparing food at their kitchens for NHS staff across the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Nicola Sturgeon's separate Scotland strategy
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon has again jumped the gun on Westminster by revealing Scotland's provisional 'exit strategy' from the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Homeless man who admits to meth addiction gets stunning makeover
item.description: A barber appears to give a free haircut to a homeless man in the US. The 30-year-old man has long, scraggly hair and a lot of facial hair, but is trimmed and clean-shaven by the end.

item.title: Judge rules woman dying from cancer should be able to leave care home despite covid-19 lockdown
item.description: An elderly woman, who has not been named, was told she had only a small amount of time remaining to live following diagnosis of terminal cancer. A long court process was required to make it happen.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Who'll dare to face the facts on obesity and Covid-19?
item.description: With each day that passes, we learn a little bit more about the nature of this ghastly virus. Statistics show that obesity is one of the biggest risk factors for Covid-19.

item.title: Why 10-year-old Max knocks grown-ups into a cocked hat! CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: The best actor on the box right now isn't Sandra Oh in Killing Eve or Lennie James in Save Me Too, remarkable as they both are.the real star of the week is Max Vento in the A-Word (BBC1)

item.title: Children CAN spread coronavirus, studies claim as NIH launches trial to track pediatric infections
item.description: One Chinese study found school closures can lower a peak in coronavirus cases by 40% to 60% and a Germany study found children carry as high levels of the virus as adults can.

item.title: Child, five, is in hospital after falling from a window in North London
item.description: The child was injured after falling from the window in Maygrove Road in Kilburn, London on Tuesday afternoon and was taken to hospital. Pictured: The crew trapped inside the basketball court.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the Government's coronavirus tracing app heading for the Isle of Wight
item.description: England expects everyone to do their duty and download the COVID-19 app

item.title: Man is stabbed to death in aisle of a Co-op after woman went 'berserk'
item.description: The elderly man, who was shopping with his wife, was stabbed and died in the aisle of the Co-op in the village of Pen-y-Graig in Rhondda, South Wales. A 29-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder.

item.title: Otters juggle with stones as a sign they are hungry
item.description: British scientists claim juggling is likely because the otters are hungry and excited to eat. Whether rock juggling is beneficial or a random hobby is yet to be determined.

item.title: Prostate cancer drugs will be made available before chemotherapy during coronavirus crisis
item.description: Two hormone treatments used in prostate cancer patients will be available before chemotherapy, as hospitals try to keep patients away from hospitals during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Rarely seen 'ghost dogs' of the Amazon moved on to endangered list, according to new study
item.description: A new study from the Amazon predicts the mysterious 'ghost dogs' of the Amazon may face new environmental threat, as deforestation is expected to reduce their natural habitat by 30 percent.

item.title: Brits are the most concerned about coronavirus, study suggests
item.description: Britons are more concerned about the coronavirus than people in any other country, including Spain and Italy, according to a new study.

item.title: A baby born in the Nazi Mauthausen camp turned 75 years old last week
item.description: Eva Nathan celebrated her 75th birthday last week, reminiscing on her journey from the place she was born, amid the darkness of the Nazi Mauthausen concentration camp in Austria.

item.title: Houston pledges to get 100 percent of its energy from renewable sources like wind and solar
item.description: The Mayor of Houston has announced a plan to move the city to 100 percent renewable energy sources starting in July, a change that's expected to save the city $65million over the next seven years.

item.title: Alan Sugar 'misled' fans when promoting tooth-whitening business he co-owns online
item.description: A row was triggered after Lord Sugar posted a tweet suggesting followers buy a Stylsmile teeth whiteening toothbrush kit, which costs £149.99, as a Christmas present. He failed to note his ownership.

item.title: Youth unemployment could hit one million this year
item.description: In a hard-hitting report, the Resolution Foundation predicted youth unemployment could top one million, more than doubling from the current level of 408,000 because of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Government scientist: I was ousted for resisting demands to 'flood' U.S. with hydroxychloroquine
item.description: Rick Bright, former director of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority, filed a formal whistleblower complaints saying he was shifted from his role as retaliation.

item.title: GERMANY SURRENDERS: One million Nazi troops lay down arms to the British in May 1945
item.description: Germany: We surrender! To mark VE Day this coming Friday, the Daily Mail has compiled a series of reports it published at the time, documenting Germany's surrender

item.title: Intensive care nurse had to choose whose hand to hold between two patients dying from coronavirus
item.description: Luke Sumner, who works in a Blackpool hospital, explained the moment he was torn between two patients and didn't know which one to sit with as they passed away from coronavirus.

item.title: UK Coronavirus death toll climbs above Britain's neighbours'
item.description: Two official measures revealed our figures had surpassed Italy's which had previously been the worst-affected nation on the Continent.

item.title: As Mail Force cheques arrive, it's clear your kindness knows no bounds
item.description: Humbled by your generosity: Whenever we've asked for your help, you've shown a magnanimous spirit. But this time we are truly staggered by the generosity of Mail readers.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Dominic Raab says opening schools too risky
item.description: Speaking at the daily No 10 press briefing, Mr Raab said evidence from scientists indicated that opening all schools would lead to a 'very real risk' of a steep rise in transmission rates.

item.title: Boris Johnson's divorce from Marina Wheeler, the mother of four of his children, is granted
item.description: Boris Johnson's second wife Marina Wheeler, 55, shares four of the Prime Minister's six children and applied for a decree absolute in February - it has now been granted.

item.title: UK in worst recession in living memory, services sector report shows
item.description: With Prime Minister Boris Johnson preparing to lay out plans to get people back to work, details of the damage already inflicted by the lockdown on vast swathes of the economy have emerged.

item.title: Planet Nine is a MIRAGE according to experts who say it is a sprawling disk of icy debris
item.description: New research suggests Planet Nine is a mirage and nothing more than 'collective gravity.' The team say it is a sprawling disk of icy debris that formed when the solar system was born.

item.title: Rock Hudson and the true- life characters behind Ryan Murphy's new Netflix miniseries, Hollywood
item.description: New Netflix show, 'Hollywood' re-imagines an alternative history to legendary actors like Rock Hudson and Hattie McDaniel in the years before they make it big in Tinseltown.

item.title: Woody Harrelson's father was twice accused of murder before being convicted of assassinating a judge
item.description: A new podcast delves into the life and crimes of contract killer Charles Harrelson, right. He was jailed over the 1979 killing of U.S. District Judge John Wood Jr in Texas. Actor Woody, left.

item.title: Having children at home is perfect chance to teach them about money
item.description: Parents up and down the country are now working from home while also trying to find the time to teach their children. But it's not just algebra they should be mugging up on.

item.title: Will cash be a victim of the virus? Businesses refuse coins and notes
item.description: Last month cash withdrawals fell by 60 per cent compared with April 2019, according to ATM operator Link, whose chief exec says the pandemic is 'speeding up' the decline of cash.

item.title: How the former Green Beret behind the failed Venezuela coup plot hatched the plan
item.description: The leader of the failed Venezuela coup struck on the idea after enlisting a billionaire backer and meeting with Donald Trump's bodyguard.

item.title: Travel firms try to charge fees and taxes over cancelled holidays
item.description: Some travel firms are punishing disappointed holidaymakers further, by charging excessive administration fees or deducting large sums of money in 'unrecoverable taxes'.

item.title: Terrifying moment three construction workers are seen riding out violent Nashville storm
item.description: Video shared by Tiffany Holt on Sunday shows the group of construction workers bracing for the intense storm in Nashville. Developers said that they workers are fine.

item.title: Whose DIY do is HAIRENDOUS... and who's queen of the lockdown locks?
item.description: Celebrity hairdresser ­Richard Ward - crimper to both real royalty and the showbiz variety - started to get panic-stricken messages quite soon into lockdown.

item.title: Disney's profits plunge 91% by $4.9 BILLION in coronavirus pandemic
item.description: Profits for the quarter ending in March dropped 91 percent to $475 million, down from $5.4 billion a year earlier. Overall, the company said costs related to COVID-19 cut pretax profit by $1.4 billion.

item.title: Coronavirus: Europe and UK strain more infectious than China's
item.description: Researchers from the University of Sheffield and Los Alamos National Laboratory in New Mexico found that a newer, faster-spreading version of the virus seems to edge out the older type.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Why Britain MUST bail out Richard Branson - however mad it sounds for the taxpayers
item.description: RUTH SUNDERLAND COLUMN: If ministers let Richard Branson's Virgin Atlantic crash into the ground, we will all be the poorer for it.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Furlough cash 'could be reduced to 60% wages'
item.description: Rishi Sunak is trying to figure out a way to 'wind down' the employee support scheme which currently sees the state pay 80 per cent of a worker's wages up to a monthly cap of £2,500.

item.title: ASK TONY:I got a £994 bill... years after I left my student digs
item.description: In June 2014 I moved out of a student house I had been living in for two years while at university. The accounts were in my name. We always paid the full amount of our energy bill on time.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: The cynical Left are hijakcing this this crisis
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Day by day, the Government is coming under attack. There are really two sorts of criticism during this dreadful Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Tom Watson 'completely enabled Carl Beech for political gain' says T'Pau singer
item.description: Carol Decker, the lead vocalist for 1980s chart-topping band T'Pau, has accused former Labour deputy leader Tom Watson of having 'completely enabled Carl Beech for political gain'.

item.title: Old RAF airbase is packed with £35m worth of cars that nobody wants amid covid-19 crisis
item.description: A former RAF base in Bicester, Oxfordshire (pictured) is keeping row after row of brand new vehicles - including luxury Range Rovers and Jaguar sports cars - worth at least £35million.

item.title: Rush-hour traffic creeps up with another 1% rise on roads around London
item.description: Number 10's deputy chief scientific adviser Professor Angela McLean expressed concern at the figures at Tuesday's Downing Street press conference.

item.title: Dominic Raab condemns 'predatory' hacking attacks amid coronavirus
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab highlighted a surge in cyber attacks on the UK and US saying criminals and 'hostile states' were trying to take advantage of the crisis for their own 'malicious ends'.
item.media:description: Last month the NCSC launched its Suspicious Email Reporting Service (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: VE Day was delayed to keep Stalin happy
item.description: The notes reveal that Winston Churchill was moments away from broadcasting the news of Germany's unconditional surrender to the Allies on May 7, but President Truman pulled him back.

item.title: Coronation Street's abuse storyline is set to carry on until Christmas
item.description: Speaking to The Sun , soap boss Iain MacLeod has revealed Yasmeen's ordeal is not over yet and will last until the end of this year.

item.title: Airbnb laying off 1,900 employees due to travel decline
item.description: In a letter to employees, chief executive Brian Chesky said the company is letting 1,900 of its 7,500 workers go and cutting businesses that do not directly support home-sharing.

item.title: Barclays customers rage as bank's systems CRASH in the middle of bounce-back loan applications
item.description: Applications for the loans, 100% guaranteed by the government, were opened on Monday with Barclays saying it received 200 applications in the first minute.

item.title: Refugees sue Germany for checking their phones
item.description: The refugees are Syrian Mohammad A, 29, who was granted refugee status in Hanover, an Afghan woman, 37, who was lodged in Berlin and a woman from Cameroon, 25 in Stuttgart.

item.title: Apple patents 'bendable' MacBook design made from single piece
item.description: Apple has filed a patent illustrating an experimental new design for a bendable laptop that would be made from a single piece of material and fold in the same way as a stack of papers.

item.title: Detectives quiz murder suspect, 42 after 79-year-old man is found dead with head injury
item.description: Anthony Rooks, 79, was discovered collapsed with a head injury at a property in Dalmeny Road, Holloway, north London at around 7.20pm on Monday. A 42-year-old man has been arrested.

item.title: Mark VE Day 75 by putting a Tommy in the Window as part of RBLI campaign to support veterans
item.description: Injured veterans have been creating a special window display at the Royal British Legion Industries' factory in Aylesford, Kent to make sure the British public can mark VE Day from the safety of their own home.

item.title: Rampaging water buffalo kills man, 57, and leaves teen in critical condition at farm in South Wales
item.description: A man has died and two people have been injured after reportedly being attacked by a water buffalo in Gwehelog, Monmouthshire, at about 2.50pm on Tuesday.

item.title: Paramedic, 22, returns to frontlines after recovering from coronavirus which left her with pneumonia
item.description: Lucy Fitton, 22, from Birmingham, said she is 'lucky to be alive' after contracting Covid-19 and then pneumonia, which left her bed-bound.

item.title: BBC will close the 'majority' of its smaller support offices used by regional news teams
item.description: The BBC has announced it is to close the 'majority' of its smaller news offices across England as part of an £80m cost-cutting drive, during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE documents hidden by government are leaked
item.description: Some 16 documents from Special Advisory Group on Emergencies (Sage) meetings since February were released this morning, taking the total to 28. But it leaves more than 90 still secret.

item.title: Magical new photographs of the wild horses on America's Cumberland Island by Anouk Krantz
item.description: The pictures, by Anouk Krantz, first appeared in book Wild Horses of Cumberland Island in 2017 - and the publisher, Images Publishing, has now released a second edition.

item.title: Does banning travellers REALLY curb coronavirus?
item.description: The UK's death toll (29,427) surpassed Italy's (29,315) today, meaning it is the worst-hit nation on the continent. But, even now, Britain's borders remain open, making it a global outlier.

item.title: Lufthansa is losing $1million every HOUR and is negotiating $10billion handout
item.description: Lufthansa is close to finalising talks with the German government to negotiate a $10billion bailout after coronavirus travel bans caused a 99 per cent drop in passenger numbers.

item.title: Traffic light system for easing lockdown mooted by experts
item.description: Behavioural experts floated a simple 'traffic light' system to classify activities as they warned people could struggle to grasp complicated new arrangements.

item.title: Brown rat takes on magpie in daylight battle before it is chased off by its sharp-beaked foe
item.description: The chase was filmed by magician Shaun Ames, 37, as he took his daily walk past Marble Arch, outside Hyde Park. It is thought the animals may have been fighting in order to protect their young.

item.title: Fans rush to speculate just how to pronounce the name of Elon Musk and Grimes' new son
item.description: Elon Musk and singer Grimes announced the birth of their first child together on Tuesday. The unusual name choice had fans guessing what it might mean and how to pronounce it.

item.title: Simple blood test could identify people at greater risk of developing cancer
item.description: Studying anonymised patient records, UK researchers found that having abnormally small red blood cells appeared to double the risk of developing cancer within the next year.

item.title: 70 per cent of new Spanish coronavirus cases in last 24 hours were among medical staff
item.description: Of Spain's total cases of the coronavirus, 18 per cent have involved health staff (pictured). One official has said that infections among healthcare workers had been less serious due to their age.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK now has Europe's HIGHEST death toll
item.description: Death certificate data from the UK's Office for National Statistics suggest that more than 40,000 people have already died of COVID-19, more victims than there were in the Blitz in World War Two.

item.title: Defiant HS2 protesters clash with workers as they refuse to leave tree-top camp in ancient woodland
item.description: Demonstrators were today confronted by officers for climbing atop a lorry, while police are investigating claims that an activist was assaulted by a worker in Crackley Woods, Warwickshire.

item.title: Expert: Cities could be treated differently to rural areas when lockdown ends
item.description: Cities and rural areas could be treated differently when coronavirus lockdown measures are eased, the Government's Chief Scientific Adviser hinted today.

item.title: Accounts worker, 65, is jailed for five years for stealing nearly half a million pounds from brewery
item.description: A court heard that Lesley Freestone, 65, (left) made hundreds of fake transactions by duplicating invoices and processing payments into her own accounts at the St Austell Brewery in Cornwall.

item.title: Experts warn there's NOTHING to stop people lying to NHS's coronavirus tracking app
item.description: The UK app is currently the only one in the world that will allow an element of self reporting - letting users trigger alerts to other people by reporting they have symptoms.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 12 different strains in March, one unique
item.description: Leading genetic scientists analysed the genomes of the killer virus in 260 infected patients from all corners of the UK. They say they have identified 12 unique mutations (shown).

item.title: Collapsed private school attended by Sarah Ferguson 'demands parents pay £3,900 summer term fees'
item.description: HawleyHurst school in Blackwater, Hampshire, went into administration last month, with HMRC claiming it is owed money. But last week parents learned they were being billed for the summer term.

item.title: Doctors say they're inundated with calls about COVID toes from people with no other symptoms
item.description: Doctors say they're being inundated with calls about COVID toes, mysterious bruises, rashes and lesions on their feet, who don't have other traditional symptoms such as fever and coughing.

item.title: India sees its highest single-day jump in coronavirus cases with 3,900
item.description: The country of 1.3billion saw its total number of cases rise to 46,432 while the death toll is now 1,568 after another 195 fatalities, India's health ministry said (pictured, a woman buying drinks in Delhi).

item.title: Is this tiny island with 100 residents on the River Thames the only coronavirus-free zone in London?
item.description: One of the capital's floating communities, Taggs Island, is tucked away from the city on a peaceful stretch of the river in Richmond upon Thames and is occupied by just over 100 residents.

item.title: Tiny shepherdess, three, tells This Morning how much she 'loves' her sheep Ethel
item.description: Barley, three, from Norfolk, who became an internet sensation after her sheep handling video went viral, has won over the hearts of the nation all over again after appearing on This Morning.

item.title: Moment reckless driver almost hits a five-year-old girl before her stepfather jumps in front of car
item.description: Dash-cam footage shows a driver almost crashing into Jason Payne, 34, and his five-year-old stepdaughter, Gracie, as the family use a zebra crossing on Green Lane in Birmingham yesterday.

item.title: EU says Britain is not seeing downward trend in coronavirus cases
item.description: EU disease control chief Andrea Ammon said the UK was one of five European countries along with Poland, Romania, Sweden and Bulgaria which have yet to see a downward trend in cases.

item.title: Hampton Court manor house is for sale for £6.5m
item.description: Prestbury House is located off Hampton Court Road in London, and boasts eight large bedrooms, substantial gardens and plenty of grand living spaces as well as modern interior.

item.title: Duck, duck, CAR! Terrifying moment driver runs over mother bird and her ducklings
item.description: The mother and her eleven ducklings were crossing a six-lane highway when the vehicle ran over them in Fort Worth, Texas. Drivers can be charged with animal cruelty for hitting ducks.
